name: Hotel Ponte Sisto

reviews.text: Ponte Sisto Hotel is centrally located to most of the major attractions in Rome. From the bridge with the same name, you can see the dome on St. Peter's Basilica, i.e., a short walk to the Vatican. The single person room I stayed in was more than adequate. The window in the room openned to the enterior courtyard. I visited in late April so the weather was very comfortable. I'm not sure if the room even had an air conditioner, but for my stay it was not needed. You might ask them if your sensitive to temperature/humidity. Breakfast at the hotel was enjoyeable with plenty of variety to choose from. I was never partial to runny scrambled eggs and soft cooked bacon, but this seems to be the norm in resturants from Asia to Europe. They had enough of a selection that there was plenty of others things to eat. The staff was pretty helpful through-out my stay. If I was planning to revisit Rome I would not yesitate to stay at the Ponte Sisto Hotel. The exterior is a little intimatating, but don't be but off by that. Once inside the hotel proper it is very nice.
reviews.title: Perfect Location for my first visit to Rome

likes.liked: — Location to cultural areas of Rome
likes.disliked: — Room size could have been larger, but this is the norm in Europe

reviews.text: We absolutely loved this hotel! We booked three rooms for a pre-cruise stay and were delighted with the property and the staff.
reviews.title: We loved it and will return!!!

reviews.text: It is in close proximity to everything we wanted to see and do - also the staff could not do enough for us. We really wanted to avoid a "chain" hotel experience and this did not disappoint. The bathrooms
reviews.title: Great Location....Very Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: in all three rooms were so gorgeous - we also loved that our rooms had balconies overlooking the courtyard.
reviews.title: very happy here

likes.disliked: — noise level from street at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is amazing and if you cross the river, dinner in Trastevere is not to be missed!
reviews.title: Good Hotel - Great position

reviews.text: This hotel was the most expensive (260 Euro) of all the places that we stayed in our 2-week vacation in Italy. Am I ever glad we spent the money! It is a quiet, calm, cool oasis in the center of noisy, bustling Rome. When your nerves are jangled from dodging the traffic and the other tourists or you're just overwhelmed by so much fantastic art and too much history, you can retreat to Ponte Sisto's courtyard and have a drink. Or just sit and read for a while. The room was not huge, but it was certainly adequate and it was very nicely appointed and very quiet. The buffet breakfast was terrific -- plenty of fruit, cereal and lots of other goodies as well as (my favorite) a bottomless pot of coffee. I'll definitely stay here again on our next trip.
reviews.title: Worth the money
Beautiful Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ponte Sisto for six nights during our holiday to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary.

reviews.title: Great Location!
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived everyone was so helpful. Our room overlooked the inner courtyard, was spacious and quiet with a large bathroom. The breakfasts were delicious.

This hotel is so central that we walked everywhere apart from a taxi for our early morning start to the Vatican Museum tour. We walked over the bridge to Trastavere for dinner most nights followed by coffee and grappa in the Campo dei Fiori.
reviews.title: At least the location worked well....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The icing on the cake was the car arranged to take us to the airport for our journey home. A well organised hotel with excellent staff and facilities in a beautiful city - thank you all!
reviews.title: Best part of Rome

likes.liked: — Just the whole look, the decoration,cleaniness, food and staff and location

reviews.text: This hotel is outstanding. The rooms are well appointed, the staff is very helpful, and the location is great. We stayed for one week and could not have been more satisfied. We generally stay in 5 star hotels, but I could not find one in Rome that would acommodate our family with adjoining rooms during the week of our trip. The Hotel Ponte Sisto has two rooms on the fifth floor to which access can be limited, effectively becoming a two bedroom, two bath suite (at a very competitive rate). The location allows for easy walks to the Forum, the Pantheon, and most of the "must see" attractions in Rome. It is also right across the Tiber River (via a short pedestrian bridge) from the Trastevere neighborhood, which provides access to numerous excellent local restaurants. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Rome.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed there 3 nights with my partner in March 2007. Overall the hotel made a very good impression. In my opinion better choice for couples rather then families.
reviews.title: good choice for weekend in Rome
Excellent location, great for a family, wish I was there now
reviews.text: I believe the strongest point is a very good location a bit outside of the busiest and most touristy districts of the city - still with short walking distance from most of the attractions. Also you will find many good restaurants around the place - especially when you cross the bridge (ask for advise at the reception if you do not have a good tourist guide book).
On the pluses side I would put also a very good quality of service and overall atmosphere of truly Italian venue - you will not feel there like being in one of those international network hotels.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms decorated nicely with good quality materials but without overwhelming "luxury" and cheap looking golden fitting.
reviews.title: Very nice but not all as advertised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ideally placed. Just 10 to 15 minutes from the Vatican, a short stroll to the Trastevere, ten minutes from Piazza Navona, Pantheon and Trevi etc.
reviews.title: Good and central
fantastic hotel in a great location, incredible view
reviews.text: Welcoming staff. Room was on the small side but had a terrace which helped. Everything you needed was there but somehow there was little wow factor. This is a tourist hotel and ideal for what it does. Remember it is breakfast only. This is very pleasant when served in the courtyard and is a well stocked buffet.

It was no drawback not having a restaurant. Osteria Ponte Sisto , which was recommended by the concierge, is just across the bridge and is very good value. Try the tripe Roman style. And it's just three minutes stagger away.
reviews.title: Great Staff. Great Hotel.

likes.liked: — The intimacy and the lovely courtyard
likes.disliked: — Nothing although the rooms are a little plain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trastevere is full of restaurants. Try Ristorante Galeassi in the piazza of Santa Maria in Trastevere (5 minutes walk). Good food and excellent service. Across the way is Ristoranti Sabatini where the food is very good but the staff treat tourists like something they found on the sole of their shoe. Not a place to go which is a pity because the food is genuinely good if pricier than Galeassi.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel and Fantastic Location

likes.liked: — Central Courtyard is a beautiful area to relax and unwind

reviews.text: This hotel is an ideal spot for a three to five day visit to Rome.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

description: Peaceful and quiet, the 4-star Hotel Ponte Sisto in Rome is located in a completely renovated historic building, enveloped in a relaxing atmosphere with a splendid garden filled with luxuriant palm trees and flowers from all over the world.The rooms are cozy and restful, able to keep the chaotic city or memories of a busy day at work at a distance to fill you will harmony and well-being within the bright marble furnishings and floral decorations.The friendly Hotel Ponte Sisto front desk staff takes care of all guest needs, booking excursions and guided tours, recommending clubs and restaurants to make your stay in Rome an unforgettable vacation or productive business trip.
